interview_tips: Research the company’s background, products, and recent news.
Prepare for common HR questions such as 'Tell me about yourself', 'Why should we hire you?', 'What are your strengths and weaknesses?', and 'Where do you see yourself in 5 years?'.
For technical roles, revise Data Structures, Algorithms, and System Design basics.
Practice coding on platforms like LeetCode, HackerRank, or GeeksforGeeks.
Dress formally: Men – formal shirt, trousers, shoes; Women – formal top/shirt with trousers or business suit. Avoid flashy colors.
Be on time — arrive at least 10-15 minutes early.
Maintain good body language: sit upright, maintain eye contact, and smile politely.
Do not interrupt the interviewer; listen carefully before answering.
Be confident but avoid sounding arrogant.
Keep your phone on silent mode during the interview.
If you don’t know an answer, admit it politely instead of guessing.
Prepare 1-2 thoughtful questions to ask the interviewer about the company or role.
Do’s: Be honest, positive, polite, and concise in your answers.
Don’ts: Don’t criticize previous employers, don’t lie about skills, don’t fidget or use slang.
Always end the interview by thanking the interviewer for their time.
